conclusion: Mass of block A, m_A = m; Mass of block B, m_B = m; Spring constant, k; Force applied, F (upward).
The system is at rest. Block B is in contact with the ground.
Objective: Find the initial acceleration of block A when the force F is applied.

premise: Initially, the spring supports the weight of block A.
conclusion: The force in the spring F_spring initially balances the weight of block A: F_spring = m_A g.
A force F is applied upward on block A.

premise: Need to find the net force acting on block A at the instant the force is applied.
conclusion: Forces on Block A: Upward force: F; Downward force: m_A g (weight of block A); Downward spring force: F_spring = m_A g (initially).

premise: Forces on Block A: Upward force: F; Downward force: m_A g; Downward spring force: F_spring = m_A g.
conclusion: Net Force on Block A: F_net = F - m_A g - F_spring = F - 2m_A g.

premise: Using Newton's second law F = ma.
conclusion: F_net = m_A a; F - 2m_A g = m_A a; a = (F - 2m_A g) / m_A.
The initial acceleration a of block A is: a = F/m_A - 2g.
